page.title: 18Cheriton Fitz. Transport
page.content: Most people who are able to drive have access to a{car.}Drivers give lifts to others. A{bus}makes two journeys on Fridays to Crediton for shopping linking with buses and trains to Exeter. Adults can use the school bus in term time. Some{suppliers} and services visit to the village regularly, which compensates for the absence of public transport. These include a butcher, a fishmonger, a county library, a hairdresser, fish & chips, a milkman, Sunday newspapers. In 1965 there was a weekly bus to Tiverton, two buses a week to Exeter, via Crediton weekly. In 1905 there were 2 horse-drawn{carriers}to Exeter each Friday. People then walked, cycled or went by pony and trap.
